name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"c73d0f77-f4fb-4072-abb5-08ca00b6404c","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Documentation: Definition & Symbol Management","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6016eb76-2762-4b61-aa8a-27eb29dc4652","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group of methods is responsible for the "Data Population" phase of the analysis. Once the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has established the structural skeleton of the code, these methods fill that skeleton with semantic details—tracking how variables are assigned, how parameters are passed, and how external data enters the system.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6c3fb01d-0c8d-4551-9e39-1bb5092c7f71","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"bcc1ee90-9b35-43c0-b2b7-abfac2bc463d","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Functional Purpose","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cfa8ae31-370c-4cfd-b591-af772ef540a1","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The primary goal of this group is ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"State Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". While the structure group defines ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"where","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" code exists, this group defines ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"what","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the code contains. By recording every definition and assignment within its specific scope, these methods allow the analyzer to build an accurate map of data flow and variable values.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c49e5e33-a8cb-45d4-9b6d-9e030177da08","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"46f0a322-67a7-4197-b815-7337fd3ad65a","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method Details","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2517406a-c8ea-4f54-8716-32b068315dbe","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_defi

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Acts as a registry tool to associate a specific ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" object with a variable name (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"target","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") inside a given namespace. This is the standard way to log that a symbol exists and has a specific meaning or value within a scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f4af4776-2a58-4354-b835-062a7ccbf54d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"handle_assign

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"A semantic wrapper typically used during the analysis of assignment statements (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x = 10","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). Like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_defi","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it routes the assignment to the correct ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" based on the namespace, ensuring that the variable ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is stored in the local definitions of that specific environment.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8be3edd7-1ce8-4aef-8da5-959bbec84ea1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_params

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Specialized for function and method signatures. It registers the arguments defined in a function header into that function's local scope. This is critical for distinguishing between local variables created during execution and the parameters provided by the caller.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e74d6f32-8237-492f-8924-c488f964860f","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_inputs

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"A utility designed to handle data entering a scope from external sources or complex argument unpacking. It retrieves the appropriate ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for the provided namespace and uses its internal ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_inputs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" logic to merge the new data (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"*args","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") into the scope's input set. This ensures the analyzer knows which values were "injected" into the scope rather than being locally derived.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9ca80801-c937-4f01-a983-d215257422f7","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"1f232e2c-3203-46b1-b934-3a2da0a712cd","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why This Group Matters","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7e716d17-d659-4993-9fe1-96689a5aeeba","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group provides the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Granular Detail","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" necessary for sophisticated analysis:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dc4ed400-62b2-4225-bff9-cdd1c777919b","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Conflict Prevention","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": It ensures that an assignment to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"data","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in one function doesn't overwrite a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"data","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" variable in a different function.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"57c4ed64-cfaf-4fca-8831-b756501b0d80","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Signature Awareness","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By using ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_params","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the analyzer can later verify if a function is being called with the correct number of arguments or track how a specific parameter is used throughout the function body.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9b57d923-0955-4e09-9153-e28014ff5d8e","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Data Origin Tracking","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Through ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_inputs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the framework can trace values back to their source, which is essential for identifying external dependencies or security-sensitive data flow.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"25b90508-daf0-4fa0-8794-8aba130546d5","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
